actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to establish an independent Special Prosecution Office, as an independent agency of the United States, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Independent Special Prosecutor Act - Sets forth the findings of Congress. Establishes an Independent Special Prosecution Office, responsible for investigating and initiating prosecution of all offenses arising out of the Presidential election of 1972 and matters relating thereto. Directs the President to appoint (within seven days of the enactment of this Act) a Special Prosecutor, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. Enumerates the powers and duties of such Special Prosecutor. Provides that the Special Prosecutor may be removed by the President for neglect of duty, malfeasance in office, or violation of this Act, but for no other cause. Authorizes to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to establish an independent Special Prosecution Office, as an independent agency of the United States, and for other purposes.
